messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: The c4se inv0lving the mysterious disappearance of local business owner Harold Jenkins took an unexpected turn when Officer Patricia O'Neil discovered a hidden compartment behind the bookshelf in Jenkins's office. Inside, she found documents that seemed to p0int to an elaborate embezzlement scheme. Meanwhile, Detective Marcus Reynolds, who had been leading the investigation, was last seen questioning the night guard, Dave Simm0ns, who worked the evening Jenkins was last seen. Simm0ns mentioned seeing a suspici0us vehicle parked outside the premises but couldn't provide a license plate number. Sergeant Liam O'Connor was tasked with reviewing the surveillance tapes from the surrounding area to identify the vehicle. During the process, Technician Emily Watson encountered an issue with the playback equipment, causing a delay in the review. Further complicating matters, Deputy Ryan Booker reported that two witnesses came forward, claiming they saw Jenkins leaving his office with an unidentified individual on the night in question. The witnesses, identified as Coroner Dr. Elizabeth Shaw and Crimin4list James Peterson, provided statements that they saw Jenkins looking distressed. Lieutenant Gregory Hayes was notified of these developments and decided to increase patrols in the area as a precaution. Patrol Officer Nancy Drew was assigned to canvass the neighborhood for any additional clues or potential witnesses.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Officer Patricia O'NeilOfficer Context: Discovered a hidden compartment in Harold Jenkins's office which contained documents indicating an embezzlement scheme.Officer Role: Police OfficerOfficer Name: Detective Marcus ReynoldsOfficer Context: Was leading the investigation into Harold Jenkins's disappearance and last seen questioning the night guard, Dave Simm0ns.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Sergeant Liam O'ConnorOfficer Context: Tasked with reviewing surveillance tapes to identify a suspicious vehicle seen on the night of Jenkins's disappearance.Officer Role: SergeantOfficer Name: Technician Emily WatsonOfficer Context: Encountered an issue with playback equipment, causing a delay in the surveillance tape review process.Officer Role: TechnicianOfficer Name: Deputy Ryan BookerOfficer Context: Reported that two witnesses came forward with information regarding Jenkins leaving his office with an unidentified individual.Officer Role: DeputyOfficer Name: Coroner Dr. Elizabeth ShawOfficer Context: Provided a statement as a witness, claiming to have seen Jenkins looking distressed while leaving his office with an unidentified individual.Officer Role: CoronerOfficer Name: Criminalist James PetersonOfficer Context: Along with Dr. Shaw, witnessed Jenkins leaving his office and provided a statement.Officer Role: CriminalistOfficer Name: Lieutenant Gregory HayesOfficer Context: Decided to increase patrols in the area following the reports of Jenkins's distressed appearance and additional witness statements.Officer Role: LieutenantOfficer Name: Patrol Officer Nancy DrewOfficer Context: Assigned to canvass the neighborhood for more clues or witnesses related to Jenkins's disappearance.Officer Role: Patrol Officer
